Metadata.Title: If You Need to Support Interoperability with Non-WCF Clients, Use Transport Security
Metadata.DirectLink: If You Need to Support Interoperability with Non-WCF Clients, Use Transport Security
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Jason Taylor, Prashant Bansode, Carlos Farre, Madhu Sundararajan, Rob Boucher, Steve Gregersen

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • Microsoft® Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) 3.5
  • Microsoft Visual Studio® 2008

What to Do

If you need to support interoperability with non-WCF clients, consider using Transport Security.

When

Use this guideline if your non-WCF clients don’t support WS-Security specification.

How

If you have non-WCF clients and if they don’t support WS-Security specification, use Transport security. Message security requires client to understand and support WS-Security specifications and hence won’t work with Non-WCF clients.

Additional Resources

  • For more information see “Message Security in WCF” at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms733137.aspx
  • For more information see “Transport Security Overview” at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms729700.aspx
